meanings.definition: Gathered into a single mass or whole.
meanings.sent1: The conglomerated toys filled the entire box.
meanings.sent2: The artist used conglomerated colors to create a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent3: The conglomerated puzzle pieces seemed to have a mind of their own.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like a conglomerated jumble, impossible to unravel.
meanings.sent5: The room was a conglomerated mess of books, papers, and clothes.

meanings.definition: Formed by the combination of different elements.
meanings.sent1: The conglomerated flavors of the dish surprised her taste buds.
meanings.sent2: The conglomerated team worked together seamlessly to achieve success.
meanings.sent3: The conglomerated sounds of the city created a unique symphony.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was a conglomerated mix of laughter and support.
meanings.sent5: The conglomerated scents of the garden filled the air with a delightful aroma.
